title: Typeface of a bank and a firm malt
content:
I need typerface of: Malta, CERVUNION, Bancoquia, BANCO COMERCIAL ANTIOQUEÑO  
Many Thanks!

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174330im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Sin%20t%C3%ADtulo_3663.png)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174330im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1005848_599347983470371_42041031_n%20(1)_5639.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174330im_/http:/typophile.com/files/27155867-jpeg_preview_medium%20-%20copia_5315.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174330im_/http:/typophile.com/files/1538655_599348136803689_242058893_n%20-%20copia_5320.jpg)

Font: 

 Optima Black 

Solved By: 

 [fvilanakis](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174330/http:/typophile.com/user/176276 "View user profile.")

author: FigoGalactic

comments.content:
"Malta" looks like a further emboldened **[Optima (Black)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174330/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Linotype&ffam=Optima%20LT%20Std%20-%20Black%20Bold&fid=da45cb9474930ec06ea28aadab624fdd&fstyle=b&fsize=60&text=Malta&fit=1)** (with modified/flattened ends?)

I can't find anything close to "CERVUNION".

"BANCO COMERCIAL ANTIOQUENO" logo can be found in AI vector format here:  
 [http://descargas.merca-web.com/descargar-b.php](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174330/http:/descargas.merca-web.com/descargar-b.php "http://descargas.merca-web.com/descargar-b.php")

The font used must be an artificially slanted **[Gill Sans (Light)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174330/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=Linotype&ffam=Gill%20Sans%20Std%20-%20Light&fid=e6c12f3accd3d86a79eee4f934219a84&fstyle=i&fsize=36&text=BANCO%20COMERCIAL%20ANTIOQUENO&wrap=2)**  
(the actual Gill Sans Light Italic is way different from your sample)

"Bancoquia" looks like **[Verdana (Bold Italic)](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174330/http:/www.findmyfont.com/index.php/fonts/font-preview?fset=MS-Windows-Fonts&ffam=Verdana%20-%20Bold%20Italic&fid=73f8d47d9791146ff2fd8924ceb14e4a&fstyle=b&fsize=60&text=Bancoquia&fit=1)** further emboldened and a bit manually compressed.

I had seen the link, but if you look closely the letter 'a' of the word 'Bancoquia' is not the same. I just got an image of more resolution, look.  
Here also you can see well 'BANCO COMERCIAL ANTIOQUEÑO'. sorry for my bad English.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174330im_/http:/typophile.com/files/398233_393411664023027_1218161656_n_4552.jpg)

Bancoquia appears to be Eras Bold, and Banco Comercial Antioqueno appears to be Eras Book Italic:

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/eras/std-bold/](http://web.archive.org/web/20150317174330/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/eras/std-bold/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/itc/eras/std-bold/")
